meanings.definition: A stem or stalk of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The caules of the flower were green and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The caules of the tomato plant grew tall in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The caules of the daisy danced in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The caules of the sunflower stood proudly in the field.
meanings.sent5: The caules of the rose were like pillars supporting the delicate petals.

meanings.definition: A plant with a thick stem or stalk.
meanings.sent1: The tree was a caules with its strong trunk reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: The pumpkin plant was a caules with its thick stem supporting the large fruit.
meanings.sent3: The caules of the cactus looked like a chubby little character.
meanings.sent4: The caules of the bamboo stood tall and straight like soldiers in formation.
meanings.sent5: The caules of the oak tree were like mighty pillars holding up the branches.

meanings.definition: The main stem of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The caules of the bean plant twisted around the support pole.
meanings.sent2: The caules of the corn plant were thick and healthy.
meanings.sent3: The caules of the pumpkin plant played hide and seek among the leaves.
meanings.sent4: The caules of the grapevine reached out in all directions seeking sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The caules of the sunflower stood tall and proud in the garden.
